thread.title: Marijuana: Test your knowledge of Oregon's new laws (quiz)
thread.title_full: Marijuana: Test your knowledge of Oregon's new laws (quiz) | OregonLive.com

author: Michelle Brence | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Marijuana: Test your knowledge of Oregon's new laws (quiz)
text:
How well do you know the law when it comes to consuming, growing and buying marijuana as legal sales get under way? Take our quiz to find out.
Oregon voters approved Measure 91, legalizing recreational marijuana for adults, in November 2014. Possessing the drug became legal July 1, 2015, and now retail sales are getting under way as part of an early sales program approved by the 2015 Legislature.
Lawmakers were concerned that consumers would have nowhere to legally buy pot for a long time after possession became legal. The Oregon Liquor Control Commission, the agency tasked with regulating the new industry, won't have a permanent retail program ready to go until late 2016.
So legislators approved a temporary program that kicks off Oct. 1 -- this Thursday.
Credit for the correct quiz answers goes to Noelle Crombie , The Oregonian/OregonLive's expert on all things marijuana; Jeff Mapes , our senior politics reporter, who followed the Legislature's many adjustments; and George Rede , who covers workplace issues.
Want to learn more? We'll be rolling out lots of coverage this week, especially Thursday as sales begin. You'll find stories at oregonlive.com . You can also read coverage at oregonlive.com/marijuana .
-- Michelle Brence
